text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Perote leaves prison while high court debates on papers he took from Cesid (defence intelligence service)
- Public prosecutor requests seven years jail for Mario Conde
- (Foreign Minister) Matutes provokes diplomatic clash with Cuba after Spanish tourist held
EL MUNDO
- Three high court judges propose declassifying Cesid papers
- Matutes threatens Cuba with blocking Spanish tourism
- Popular Party and Catalan coalition CiU propose widows can remarry without losing pension
- Link between British Telecom and Telefonica opens world battle between giant operators
CINCO DIAS
- "Liofonica" (telecoms mess)- Telefonica outlines deal with BT, but invites Portugal into Unisource, but talking to AT&T and will enter film sector
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- France Telecom freezes offer to buy Retevision
- Banks will open euro accounts from January 1, 1999
- Pensioners to pay prescriptions according to income
- Speculators distort Adolfo Dominguez shares
EXPANSION
- Speculation blocks one million Adolfo Dominguez shares
- AT&T chairman makes urgent trip to Madrid to brake Telefonica-BT alliance
- France Telecom wants to enter Airtel with BCH
- Banks association warns that narrower margins have not bottomed out
-- Madrid Newsroom, + 341 585 8340
